repnme.cdata!:
Saint Lucia, Grenada, Saint Vincent, the
            Grenadines and Dominica - E-government for Regional
            Integration Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The E-government for Regional
            Integration Project for Grenada received a moderately
            satisfactory outcome rating with a moderate risk to
            development. Both the Bank and the Borrower received
            moderately satisfactory performance ratings. There were two
            restructurings that took place throughout this project. The
            results of the restructuring are as follows: the projects
            indicators were modified to align them with the projects
            outcomes and outputs, an extension of the closing date of
            credit agreements for Dominica, Grenada, and St. Lucia to
            align them with St. Vincent and accommodate the closing date
            to the completion of activities for the two projects. The
            project was then restructured again to extend the closing
            date of all credits by six months and extend the closing
            date of all credits by six months. There are several lessons
            learned from this project and are as follows: (1) Too broad
            a design risks to diminish/distort the focus of a project
            during implementation. (2) Adequate project preparation time
            versus other considerations must be explicit. (3) A regional
            approach for Information and Communications Technologies
            (ICT) projects for small island states shows strengths and
            weaknesses to be considered at the time of design. (4)
            Importance of establishing mechanisms to generate and
            maintain countries commitment to the Project, throughout
            the project. (5) Good project management is key. (6)
            Importance of providing training to successfully achieve the
            PDO. Training of stakeholders is key to ensure that Project
            activities are implemented and outcomes are achieved during
            the life of the Project. (7) Continuous training and
            awareness building is crucial to successfully implement
            legislation, after the Projects completion. (8) Governance
            arrangements can significantly contribute to successful
            implementation: Finding the appropriate institution to
            champion a reform or a new system can be critical to its
            rapid success. (9) Need for implementation of the national
            ICT policies in order to support E-Government for Regional
            Integration Project outcomes. (10) Project coordination
            affects implementation. The existence of competing projects
            required extensive consultations and slowed implementation
            down. (11) A programmatic approach should be considered to
            support ICT projects.

repnme.cdata!:
OECS Countries - E-Government for Regional
            Integration Program (APL) Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall development objective of the
            E-Government for Regional Reform Program (APL) Project for
            Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS) countries is
            to promote the efficiency, quality, and transparency of
            public services through the delivery of regionally
            integrated e-government applications that apply economies of
            scale. This restructuring paper: (i) an extension of the
            closing date of three country projects under the first OECS
            project, comprising Dominica, Grenada and St. Lucia. The
            closing date will be extended from June 30, 2012 to August
            31, 2013, to align the date to the closing date of the St
            Vincent and the Grenadines Project, which constitutes a
            second phase of the Adaptable Program Lending (APL); and
            (ii) the modification of indicators from the Monitoring and
            Evaluation (M&E) framework for all the four country
            projects under the project, as some indicators do not longer
            reflect the outcomes of the project.

display_title.display_title:
OECS Countries - E-Government for
            Regional Integration Program (APL) Project : restructuring
            : Main report
